chapter.title: Command line interface of &vmim;
chapter.para: &vmim; has a many command line options it will print the command line options if it cannot find a task, tasks are operations on hosts. Running &vmim; with no command line options.
chapter.screen: &prompt-root;vmimagemanager Error: No task selected -h, --help Display help information -v, --version Version -c, --config Set config file -p, --print-config Print config -b, --box [host] Set Virtual Box -s, --store [image] Store Virtual Box as parameter -r, --restore [image] Restore Virtual Box as parameter -i, --insert [component]:[dir] insert component to a Virtual Box -e, --extract [component]:[dir] extract component from a Virtual Box -D, --debug [Level] Set the debug level -u, --up Start Virtual Box -d, --down Stop Virtual Box -l, --list-boxes List Virtual Boxes -L, --list-images List Virtual Box Images -k, --kill Kill Virtual Box -z, --tgz tar.gz Virtual Box Image -m, --locked List Locked slots -f, --free List Free slots. -U, --used List Used slots -y, --rsync rsync Virtual Box Image [Default] -C, --cpu CPU cores

section.title: Command option --help -h
section.para: Shows the command line help. This book help is more detailed.

section.title: Command option --version -v
section.para: Shows the version of &vmim; this is taken from the tag it was checked out with or will be "Development" for other versions checked out from non tags.

section.title: Command option --config -c [filename]
section.para: Over rides teh default config file with a specified config file.

section.title: Command option --print-config -c
section.para: Prints an abbreviated list of configuration options, including available host names. Where the images are stored and where the components of images are stored.

section.title: Command option --box -b [host]
section.para: Select the host to operate on with &vmim; will operate. Host is a mandatory option as you must specify the host, if the host identifier is unknown please use an incorrect string and &vmim; will return a list of available hosts.
section.screen: &prompt-root;vmimagemanager -b sdfkldsfjsldfj Host 'sdfkldsfjsldfj' not found! Try .. wels.desy.de graz.desy.de baden.desy.de krems.desy.de linz.desy.de steyr.desy.de traun.desy.de wien.desy.de leoben.desy.de

section.title: Command option --store -s [image]
section.para: Will store an image of the host operating on, the attribute image is required. The host being set with the --box -b option which is mandatory for this option to proceed. This operation is a task.
The store operation will stop a running host, mount the file system, store the image in the correct directory, unmount the file system, and restart the host.

section.title: Command option --restore -r [image]
section.para: Will restore an image of the host previously stored, the attribute image is required. The host being set with the --box -b option which is mandatory for this option to proceed. This operation is a task.
The restore operation will stop a running host, mount the file system, copy the image in to the mounted file system, unmount the file system and restart the host.

section.title: Command option --insert -i [component]:[dir]
section.para: This option is used to insert a subdirectory into the image being installed. The attribute consists of too components, the identifier of the component and the subdirectory which is stored, these two fields are delimited by ":" the directory is optional and not required.

section.title: Command option --extract -e [component]:[dir]
section.para: This option is used to extract a subdirectory and store it independently from the image. The attribute consists of too components, the identifier of the component and the subdirectory which is stored, these two fields are delimited by ":".

section.title: Command option --debug -D
section.para: sets teh debug level, over riding the value specifed in the configuration or enviroment.

section.title: Command option --up -u
section.para: Start the host specified with the -b --box option. This unmounts the file system, and starts the image that is present on the file system.

section.title: Command option --down -d
section.para: Stop the host specified with the -b --box option. This stops the image and mounts the file system.

section.title: Command option --list-boxes -l
section.para: List Virtual Boxes available.

section.title: Command option --list-images -L
section.para: List Virtual Box images available for the box you have selected with the --box -b option.

section.title: Command option --kill -k
section.para: Kill's the virtual box even if it wont stop, this wont always work and if it does not, the only way you can recover the VM is to reboot the complete xen domain zero. You must have specified a box using the --box -b option.

section.title: Command option --tgz -z
section.para: When used with the --store -s option will store the virtual machine image as a tgz image, rather than the default rsync method.

section.title: Command option --locked -m
section.para: Useful for locking the VM while operating are beign performed.

section.title: Command option --free -f
section.para: Returns a list of not running &vm; that are not locked.

section.title: Command option --used -U
section.para: Returns a list of running &vm; or locked &vm;'s.

section.title: Command option --rsync -y
section.para: When used with the --store -s option will store the virtual machine image as a copy of the current image, this is faster than compressing the image, and for repreat installs minimizes the data transfered.

section.title: Command option --cpu -C
section.para: Sets the number of cores to give to the &vm;.
